titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Rice University School of Humanities Collection, circa 1970s-2000s UA 416
titlestmt.author: Traci Patterson

publicationstmt.publisher: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

note.p: Stored onsite at the Woodson Research Center.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-08-17 13:52:33 -0500.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.unittitle: Rice University School of Humanities Records
did.abstract: The collection includes comic art materials from art exhibitions held in Hosuton between 2015 and 2018.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Rice's School of Humanities offers programs in disciplines traditionally associated with the humanities as well as pushing beyond disciplinary boundaries to explore what it means to be human in all its ramifications. Departments include: Art History; Classical and European Studies; English; History; Philosophy; Religion; Spanish, Portuguese and Latin American Studies; and Visual and Dramatic Arts. Five of these departments train graduate students for the PhD: Art History, English, History, Philosophy, and Religion. Excerpt from: https://humanities.rice.edu/

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Comick art posters and booklets, a card, and an exhibit inventory document some materials available at art exhibits in Houston area between 2015 and 2018. Of particular note is the Mexican comic art from the 1970s.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The material is open for research. Stored onsite at the Woodson Research Center.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials were donated by Chris Speraoia in 2019.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Rice University School of Humanities Collection, circa 1970s-2000s, UA 416, Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Rice University School of Humanities Collection must be obtained from the Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library.

The Woodson Research Center use policy is that researchers assume sole responsibility for any infringement of privacy, literary rights, copyrights, or other rights arising from their use of the archival materials. In addition to any restrictions placed by donors, certain kinds of archival materials are restricted for the life of the creator plus 50 years. These materials include, but are not limited to, student grades, transcripts, and any job applications or recommendations.
